actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.
Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Packwood with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 98-450.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 876.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

official_title: A bill to provide authorization of appropriations for activities carried out under the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation with amendment,S.Rept.98-450) Amends the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 to authorize appropriations for FY 1985 through 1988 to the Departments of Commerce and Interior for activities under title I of the Act and to the Marine Mammal Commission (Commission) for activities under title II of the Act. Requires the President to select nominees for membership on the Commission from a single list submitted, after consultation with each other, by specified Federal agencies. Requires the Commission to be staffed at a level of not less than 11 employees. Requires the Secretary of Commerce (Secretary) to obtain documentation from foreign nations wishing to import yellowfin tuna into the United States that such foreign tuna fishing operations are conducted: (1) under a regulatory program which is no less protective of marine mammal populations than is the U.S. program; and (2) with a comparable rate of incidental taking as the U.S. program. Extends the marine mammal permit held by the American Tunaboat Association. Subjects such extension to specified conditions. Requires the Secretary to carry out a program of research on marine mammal populations to monitor the effect yellowfin tuna fishing is having on them. Directs the Secretary to take appropriate action upon a determination that such populations are being adversely affected due to incidental taking during such yellowfin tuna fishing. Requires the Secretary to report to Congress annually on the results of such research program and to reference any funding problems which might hamper such research.

titles.title: A bill to provide authorization of appropriations for activities carried out under the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972.
